results.title: Our fragile coast: The Coast, a question of balance
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development and David Hughes
results.brief_description: The first half of this compilation tape focuses on erosion and deposition at Port Campbell, the Gippsland Lakes and Port Phillip, to be used in conjunction with the Earth in Action topic of the Year 12 Geography course; the second shows how competing human interests could destroy the coastal ecology.

results.title: Leah; Water rats; Alison; Tracey
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Dept. of Health and Sabina Baltrukomis
results.brief_description: A compilation tape consisting of four programmes designed to promote discussion in the area of human relations. 1. Leah. Concerns the feelings of an adolescent girl in regard to her alcoholic father who embarrasses her in front of her friends. 2. Water rats. Looks at the peer pressure exerted amongst a group of adolescents to conform to the group’s standards. 3. Alison. Looks at the problems of an adolescent girl who cannot adjust to her single father’s need to have adult female companionship. 4 Tracey. Considers the situation of an adolescent girl subjected to pressure by her domineering father to perform well academically.
results.creator_credit_for_label: New South Wales. Dept. of Health and Sabina Baltrukomis

results.title: Fatness, foods, fads (compilation)
results.brief_description: Fatness, foods and fads outlines the 5 food groups and examines the fallacies of diets such as the Israeli army diet, the no carbohydrate diet, the grapefruit diet and the macrobiotic diet. 2. “Energy, food and exercise” shows how to achieve a proper balance of food and exercise for particular needs. 3.”Whats cooking” highlights the health problems that abound in the unhygienic kitchen and poses solutions. Compared by Andrew Daddo.

results.title: [The Tatler social newsreel]
results.brief_description: This film was one of the many documentaries shot in Victoria by Efftee Studios in the early 30s. In this newsreel compiled and narrated by Peter Newmarch of “The Truth” newspaper and shot by Bert Nicholas, several Melbourne socialites are featured at various functions: a social party in South Yarra, the first official meeting of the Centenary Dog Club at the Melbourne Showground and Ron Cameron’s Riding School. NOTE: No titles included.

results.title: The Age of change
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Looks at the impact of technological change on the Melbourne newspaper ‘The Age’ and considers this change in terms of its effect on the people involved. Highlights the increasing competition at the desk of reporters and editors from electronic information systems, and the impact of technology on the once labour-intensive area of printing.

results.title: Factory to farm
results.brief_description: Shows the various stages in the manufacture of farm implements and machinery and their use on Australian wheat farms during the 1920s. An important film on Australian history, both from farming and the “Sunshine Harvester Factory” points of view. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Punkline
results.creator_credit: Tony Stevens, Sue Davis and Kali Productions
results.brief_description: Shot at the Crystal Ballroom and Festival Hall during performances of the B 52’s, The Cure, La Femme and The Models, this film provides an observation not of the New Wave performers, but of the people who go to see them. Soundtrack from a tape by Equal Local.

results.title: Versatility in glass
results.brief_description:
Public relations film outlining the nature of glass: how it is made; how it can be used in its many and varied forms for decoration, safety and protection in the home, industry and transportation.
Suitable for upper primary and lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: The Youth who wanted to shiver
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow, Acton Films and Bosustow Entertainment
results.brief_description: An animated adaptation of the classic fairy tale by the Brothers Grimm, about Jack who knows no fear and wants to be able to shiver. All help fails until his bride pours a bucket of tiny fish over him.

results.title: Fisherman & his wife: a Grimm's fairy tale
results.creator_credit: Sam Weiss, C B Wismar, Nick Bosustow, Churchill Films and Bosustow Entertainment
results.brief_description: A Grimm’s fairy tale about a humble fisherman who frees a prince from a spell. The fisherman’s wife siezes the opportunity to have all her wishes granted but ends up where she started, thus learning a bitter lesson.
